TEXT.TITLE: IRAN SAYS U.S. NAVAL FORCES ATTACKED TWO PLATFORMS
TEXT.BODY: Iran said U.S. Naval forces attacked two of its oil platforms in the southern Gulf on Monday afternoon, the Iranian news agency IRNA reported. IRNA, received in Nicosia, said an informed source at the Iranian oil ministry identified the two platforms as Resalat and Reshadat, about 60 miles from Iran's Lavan island oil storage site. Regional shipping sources earlier said three Iranian offshore oil sites at Sassan, Rostam and Rakhsh had been attacked at 7.00 A.M. (0300 GMT) on Monday by unidentified aircraft. In Washington, U.S. Defence Secretary Caspar Weinberger said four U.S. Destroyers attacked and destroyed an Iranian oil platform about 120 miles east of Bahrain. REUTER
